# Connect to your Delta table
delta_df =spark.read.format("delta").load( f"abfss://dl-juror-eric-voters-temp@baubaisadfsastg.dfs.core.windows.net/voters_deduplicated_delta")

# Count total rows
total_rows = delta_df.count()

# Count unique hash_ids
unique_ids = delta_df.select("hash_id").distinct().count()

# See how many duplicates we're dealing with
print(f"Total rows: {total_rows}")
print(f"Unique hash_ids: {unique_ids}")
print(f"Duplicate rows: {total_rows - unique_ids}")

# Optional: Sample a few duplicated records to examine
duplicated_ids = delta_df.groupBy("hash_id").count().filter("count > 1").select("hash_id")
sample_duplicates = delta_df.join(duplicated_ids, "hash_id").orderBy("hash_id")
display(sample_duplicates.limit(10))

from pyspark.sql.functions import col, count

# Check for duplicates based on hard_id
duplicate_hashids = df_single.groupBy("hash_id").count().filter(col("count") > 1)

# Get the count of distinct hard_id values that have duplicates
duplicate_count = duplicate_hashids.count()
print(f"Found {duplicate_count} distinct hash_id values that appear more than once")

# Show some examples of duplicated hard_id values
if duplicate_count > 0:
    print("Examples of duplicated hard_id values:")
    duplicate_hashids.orderBy(col("count").desc()).show(5)
    
    # Get a sample hard_id that has duplicates
    sample_hashdid = duplicate_hashids.first()["hash_id"]
    
    # Show all records with this hard_id
    print(f"Records with hard_id = {sample_hardid}:")
    df.filter(col("hash_id") == sample_hashid).show()
else:
    print("No duplicates found based on hash_id")

from pyspark.sql.functions import count

final_count = df.groupBy('creation_date','rec_num','AdtclmnInsertedByProcessName') \
    .agg(count('rec_num')) \
    .orderBy('creation_date')

display(final_count)
